author: Special Correspondent
text:
Staging a demonstration demanding Rs. 30 per kg as price for green tea leaves for the benefit of small tea growers, Pattali Makkal Katchi (PMK) leader S. Ramadoss on Monday said that the State had witnessed 12 per cent negative growth in agriculture and three per cent negative growth in the industrial sector.

Speaking at the demonstration, Mr. Ramadoss alleged that the State under AIADMK rule had gone through a serious economic slide and had failed on many fronts.

Dr. Ramadoss accused the Chief Minister Jayalalithaa of having pushed the State into a debt of Rs. 4 lakh crore.

Mr. Ramadoss also predicted that the final trial before the Supreme Court in the disproportionate assets case against the Chief Minister commencing on February 2 wherein the verdict of the trial court will be upheld and Ms. Jayalalithaa will be disqualified for the third time.Similarly, the trial in 2 G spectrum scam commencing on February 1 will result in confirmation of conviction for all those involved.

Stating that PMK will emerge victorious and form the Government, Dr. Ramadoss said that no party has come forward for an alliance with the PMK. The party will start receiving forms for contesting from 234 constituencies from Pongal.

If PMK was voted to power, it would ensure compulsory, cost and burden less quality education and quality and affordable health care for all, total prohibition and Lok Ayukta to combat corruption will be the priorities.

On the minimum price of Rs. 30 for tea leaves, Dr. Ramadoss said that it would benefit 65,000 small and medium tea growers.
title: TN witnessing a negative growth: Ramadoss
